main.namespaceMismatch:
Cite Forge only runs on the Main, User (if "Enable in User namespace"), and Draft namespaces. In other namespaces, this message shows up when toggling "Show Cite Forge".

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
data.diffPreview.summary: The edit summary autofilled to Cite Forge proposed edits.
ui.default.nameless: A reference that is not yet named.
ui.default.close:
Label for "Close" button used in dialogues, alerts and prompts.
{{Identical|Close}}
ui.default.cancel:
Label for "Cancel" button used in dialogues, alerts and prompts.
{{Identical|Cancel}}
ui.default.copied: A concise alert message showing that anything (e.g., citation name, reference name, reference text) is copied to the clipboard.
ui.citations.copy:
Label of button to copy text to clipboard.
{{Identical|Copy}}
ui.citations.copyPermalink:
A concise label of the floating popup that allows copying the permanent link (permalink) of a citation/reference.

Such permalink on Wikipedia looks like this: <nowiki>"[[Special:Permalink/" + revision ID + "#" + citation/reference anchor + "]]".</nowiki>

For example, this is the first citation's permalink on the English Wikipedia article "Barack Obama": <nowiki>[[Special:Permalink/1333299244#cite_ref-1|#1]]"</nowiki>
ui.citations.jumpToInspector:
A concise label of the floating popup that allows jumping from a citation/reference to the inspector's corresponding entry.

The "inspector" is the main interface of Cite Forge, a floating panel that normally shows at the bottom left of the screen.
ui.portlet.showCiteForge:
A portlet label that toggles the Cite Forge's appearance.

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
ui.portlet.hideCiteForge:
A portlet label that toggles the Cite Forge's appearance.

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
ui.panel.launcher.title:
The tooltip message when hovering the floating button that is normally displayed at the bottom left of the screen, when Cite Forge is toggled active.

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
ui.panel.launcher.label:
The label of the floating button that is normally displayed at the bottom left of the screen, when Cite Forge is toggled. Should normally be in plural form.
{{Identical|Citation}}
ui.panel.headerTitle:
The title of the floating panel referred to as the "inspector".

The "inspector" is the main interface of Cite Forge, a floating panel that normally shows at the bottom left of the screen.

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
ui.panel.collapse:
Label for "Collapse" button used to collapse the Cite Forge inspector.
{{Identical|Collapse}}
ui.panel.search.placeholder: A placeholder message in the search bar of the Cite Forge inspector, which allows searching references in the page.
ui.panel.search.ariaLabel:
An aria-label in the search bar of the Cite Forge inspector, which allows searching references in the page.

Aria-label is used for screen readers.
ui.panel.refresh:
Label for "Refresh" button used to refresh the reference list in the Cite Forge inspector.
{{Identical|Refresh}}
ui.panel.copyOptions.raw: A concise dropdown menu entry that asks the user which format is preferred when copying a reference name. This dropdown menu entry allows the user to copy the raw reference name without formats.
ui.panel.placement.keep: A concise dropdown menu entry that asks the user which placement of references is preferred when saving. This dropdown menu entry allows the user to save references in its original place without shifting.
ui.panel.placement.threshold: A concise dropdown menu entry that asks the user which placement of references is preferred when saving. This dropdown menu entry allows the user to move references with ≥ N uses to the reflist. N denotes a variable.
ui.panel.placement.allLdr: A concise dropdown menu entry that asks the user which placement of references is preferred when saving. This dropdown menu entry allows the user to move all references to the reflist.
ui.panel.placement.allInline: A concise dropdown menu entry that asks the user which placement of references is preferred when saving. This dropdown menu entry allows the user to move all references inside the article content.
ui.panel.unnamedReference: A reference that is not yet named.
ui.panel.editRefName: The tooltip message when hovering the edit icon next to a reference name.
ui.panel.nameReference: The tooltip message when hovering the edit icon next to an unnamed reference.
ui.panel.copyRefName: The tooltip message when hovering the copy icon next to a reference name.
ui.panel.usesPrefix:
A concise label that shows how many occurrances a reference is cited.
{{Identical|Use}}
ui.panel.noContent: A label displayed in place of reference content when a reference has no content or when Cite Forge fails to capture the content.
ui.panel.copyRaw.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Copy raw" button, which allows the user to copy the reference's content.
ui.panel.copyRaw.label: The label of a button which allows the user to copy the reference's content.
ui.panel.jumpToCitations.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Jump to citations" button, which locates the corresponding citations of a reference in the article.
ui.panel.jumpToCitations.label: The label of a button which locates the corresponding citations of a reference in the article.
ui.panel.jumpToReference.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Jump to reference" button, which locates the reference in the reflist.
ui.panel.jumpToReference.label: The label of a button which locates the reference in the reflist.
ui.panel.referenceJumpUnavailable: This message shows up when failed to locate a reference entry on the page.
ui.panel.editContent.openTitle: The tooltip message when hovering the "Edit raw" button, which allows the user to edit raw content of a reference.
ui.panel.editContent.closeTitle: The tooltip message when hovering the "Edit raw" button when edit mode is active, which allows the user to edit raw content of a reference.
ui.panel.editContent.openLabel: The label of a button which allows the user to edit raw content of a reference.
ui.panel.editContent.closeLabel: The label of the "Edit raw" button when edit mode is active, which allows the user to edit raw content of a reference.
ui.panel.editContent.fieldLabel:
An aria-label in the text box, which allows the user to edit raw content of a reference.

Aria-label is used for screen readers.
ui.panel.noRefToCopy: This message shows up when no references are selected, therefore nothing to copy.
ui.panel.noMassRenameChanges: This message shows up when no changes are applied from the mass rename.
ui.panel.massRenamePopulated: This message shows up when changes have populated back to the Cite Forge inspector, after a successful mass rename.
ui.panel.resolveDuplicates: This message shows up when there exist duplicate reference names and saving is not allowed.
ui.panel.noPendingChanges: This message shows up when no changes are pending to apply in Cite Forge.
ui.panel.noChangesGenerated: This message shows up when no changes were generated in Cite Forge.
ui.panel.diffSummary: The edit summary autofilled to Cite Forge proposed edits.
ui.panel.openingDiff: This message shows up when changes have successfully applied and a diff view shows up for the user to review.
ui.panel.diffFailed: This message shows up when changes fail to apply or the diff view fails to show up.
ui.panel.emptyState: This label shows up in place of the reference list, when no references were found on the page.
ui.panel.saveButton.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Save ($1)" button, which allows the user to save pending changes on Cite Forge inspector.
ui.panel.saveButton.label:
The label of a button which allows the user to save pending changes on Cite Forge inspector.
$1 is the number of changes.
ui.panel.settingsButton.title:
The tooltip message when hovering the "Settings" button.
{{Identical|Settings}}
ui.panel.settingsButton.label:
Label of the "Settings" button.
{{Identical|Settings}}
ui.panel.massRenameButton.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Mass rename" button.
ui.panel.massRenameButton.label: Label of the "Mass rename" button, which allows the user to mass rename the references in a page.
ui.panel.checksButton.title: The tooltip message when hovering the "Checks" button, which displays all citation errors on a page.
ui.panel.checksButton.label: Label of the "Checks" button, which displays all citation errors on a page.
ui.panel.harvLink:
A link to the "Harv checks reference table", a reference table of all citation errors.

This link text should be translated.
ui.panel.settings.title:
The title of the Settings dialog of Cite Forge.

The name "Cite Forge" should not be translated.
ui.panel.settings.copyFormat:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

The format of the reference name that is copied to the clipboard.
ui.panel.settings.showCitationPopup:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether to display popups when hovering a citation on the page.
ui.panel.settings.enableUserNs:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether to allow Cite Forge to run in User namespace.
ui.panel.settings.placement:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

The placement of the references on a page.
ui.panel.settings.minUses:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

How many uses are needed for a reference to be moved to the reflist.
ui.panel.settings.preferTemplateR:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether the user prefers using <nowiki>{{r}}</nowiki> template to write citations; if not, then <nowiki><ref></nowiki> is used.
ui.panel.settings.preferTemplateReflist:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether the user prefers using <nowiki>{{reflist}}</nowiki> template to write references; if not, then <nowiki><references></nowiki> is used.
ui.panel.settings.keepCopies:
A concise label for a Settings entry.
Whether to keep separate copies of identical references; if not, Cite Forge will perform automatic dedupe.
ui.panel.settings.normalize:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether to normalize reference markups.
ui.panel.settings.cosmeticSaves:
A concise label for a Settings entry.

Whether to allow cosmetic-only saves.

This link is dynamic: use your wiki's corresponding page link if it's not WP:COSMETICBOT.
ui.massRename.fields.last.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

Author's last name of a reference.
ui.massRename.fields.last.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "last" or "author" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.first.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

Author's first name of a reference.
ui.massRename.fields.first.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "first" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.author.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

Author's full name, including first and last name.
ui.massRename.fields.author.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "author" fields or a combination of "first" + "last" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.title.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "title", "chapter", "contribution" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.work.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The publication name of a reference.
ui.massRename.fields.work.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "work", "journal", "newspaper", "website", "periodical" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.publisher.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The publisher name of a reference.
ui.massRename.fields.publisher.descripti:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses "publisher", "institution" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.domain.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The website domain derived from a reference's URL.
ui.massRename.fields.domain.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

The website domain derived from a reference's URL.
ui.massRename.fields.domainShort.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The website domain derived from a reference's URL, but the extension suffix is trimmed out.
ui.massRename.fields.domainShort.descrip:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

The website domain derived from a reference's URL, but the extension suffix is trimmed out.
ui.massRename.fields.phrase.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The first few words of the reference text.
ui.massRename.fields.phrase.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

The first few words of the reference text.
ui.massRename.fields.year.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.
{{Identical|Year}}
ui.massRename.fields.year.description:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

Uses the year number derived from "year", "date" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.fields.fulldate.label:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

The full date, in the format of eight digits: yyyymmdd.
ui.massRename.fields.fulldate.descriptio:
A concise description for a mass rename scheme's component.

The full date, in the format of eight digits: yyyymmdd.

Uses the "date" fields of <nowiki>{{Cite ...}}</nowiki> templates.
ui.massRename.increment.latin:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

Latin letter indices starting with lowercase a.
ui.massRename.increment.numeric:
A concise label for a mass rename scheme's component.

Arabic number indices starting with 2.
ui.massRename.errors.empty: This error message shows when a name is not given for a reference.
ui.massRename.errors.numericOnly: This error message shows when a name given for a reference is composed only with numbers.
ui.massRename.errors.invalidChars: This error message shows when a name given for a reference contains invalid characters.
ui.massRename.errors.conflict: This error message shows when a name given for a reference is in conflict with another reference name.
ui.massRename.noChanges: This message shows up when no rename changes are to apply.
ui.massRename.appliedToInspector:
This message shows up when changes are successfully populated back to Cite Forge inspector.

The "inspector" is the main interface of Cite Forge, a floating panel that normally shows at the bottom left of the screen.
ui.massRename.noInspector:
This error message shows up when the Cite Forge inspector fails to load or fails to receive the changes provided by the mass rename.

The "inspector" is the main interface of Cite Forge, a floating panel that normally shows at the bottom left of the screen.
ui.massRename.applyFailed: This error message shows up when the changes couldn't apply.
ui.massRename.dialog.title: Title of the mass rename dialog, which allows the user to mass rename references.
ui.massRename.dialog.subtitle:
Subtitle of the mass rename dialog, which allows the user to mass rename references.

Reference names can be generated from the template data through mass rename schemes.
ui.massRename.dialog.addNamingPartsPlace: Placeholder text to prompt user to add "naming parts" (naming elements) to the mass rename scheme.
ui.massRename.dialog.noMatchingFields: This label shows in place of "naming parts" dropdown when no matching fields are present.
ui.massRename.dialog.namingPartsLabel:
Mass rename dialog's main concept, the building blocks of a mass rename scheme.

Used here as a label, so the first letter should be capitalized.
ui.massRename.dialog.namingPartsDescript: Description to "Naming parts", the mass rename dialog's main concept, the building blocks of a mass rename scheme.
ui.massRename.dialog.collisionSuffix:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

The suffixes added to the proposed names when collision occurs.
ui.massRename.dialog.delimiter:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

{{Identical|Delimiter}}
ui.massRename.dialog.delimiterConditiona:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether the delimiter only appears after numbers.
ui.massRename.dialog.spaceReplacement:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to replace space with underscore.
ui.massRename.dialog.convertYearDigits:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to convert non-ASCII digits (e.g., Arabic-Indic ٠١٢٣..., Extended Arabic-Indic ۰۱۲۳..., Devanagari ०१२३..., fullwidth ０１２３...) to ASCII counterparts.
ui.massRename.dialog.lowercase:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to convert uppercase letters to lowercase.
ui.massRename.dialog.stripDiacritics:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to remove diacritics of letters.
ui.massRename.dialog.stripPunctuation:
A concise label for a Settings entry in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to remove punctuations.
ui.massRename.dialog.regenerate: Label of a button, which allows the user to regenerate the mass naming results should the Settings changed.
ui.massRename.dialog.reset:
Label of a button, which allows the user to reset the mass rename scheme back to defaults.

{{Identical|Reset}}
ui.massRename.dialog.filterPlaceholder: Placeholder text for the reference search bar in the mass rename dialog.
ui.massRename.dialog.showUnselected:
A concise label for a checkbox in the mass rename dialog.

Whether to show unselected reference entries.
ui.massRename.dialog.selectAllAria:
Aria-label for the checkbox in the mass rename dialog, asking whether to select all references.

Aria-label is used for screen readers.
ui.massRename.dialog.colReference:
Column header for the table of references. Cells in "Reference" column contain the reference content.
{{Identical|Reference}}
ui.massRename.dialog.colUses:
Column header for the table of references. Cells in "Uses" column contain the number of citations a reference have.
{{Identical|Use}}
ui.massRename.dialog.colSuggestedName: Column header for the table of references. Cells in "Uses" column contain the suggested new reference name based on user's mass rename scheme.
ui.massRename.dialog.noInlineContent: A label displayed in place of reference content when a reference has no content or when Cite Forge fails to capture the content.
ui.massRename.dialog.metaWork: Label for the publication work field.
ui.massRename.dialog.reapply: Label of a button, which allows the user to reapply the mass rename scheme.
ui.massRename.dialog.noMatches: This label shows up in place of the reference table, when no references matched the filter.
ui.massRename.dialog.footerSelected: Label displayed at the footer, showing how many references are selected.
ui.massRename.dialog.footerConflicts: Label displayed at the footer, showing how many rename conflicts occurr.
ui.massRename.dialog.sendToInspector:
Label of the button which sends all pending mass rename changes back to the Cite Forge inspector.

The "inspector" is the main interface of Cite Forge, a floating panel that normally shows at the bottom left of the screen.
ui.massRename.dialog.suggestedAria:
An aria-label for the text boxes for the suggested reference names.

Aria-label is used for screen readers.
